predictions.text: Waymo will publicly confirm closing a single equity financing round of at least $12.0 billion in disclosed proceeds by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Waymo/Alphabet (or lead investors) issue a press release, blog post, or SEC filing stating the round is closed/raised and discloses aggregate proceeds >= $12.0B (or multiple tranches explicitly described as one round totaling >= $12.0B).
monitoring_signals: Waymo/Alphabet investor relations filings and press releases
Term sheet leaks naming lead investor(s) and round size
PitchBook/CB Insights round-close entries
Regulatory notices for large private placements (where applicable)
predictions.rationale: Reported late-stage fundraising size is very large but plausible given capex needs and strong AI/AV capital demand; closure timing is uncertain but a 5-month window is reasonable.

predictions.text: The FCC will issue a public notice accepting for filing (or otherwise docketing for public comment) SpaceX’s application(s) for its proposed 'satellite data center' / orbital data-center units, by 2026-05-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if an FCC ECFS/IBFS docket and/or FCC public notice explicitly references SpaceX (or a wholly owned subsidiary) and an application to deploy orbital 'data center' satellites/units consistent with the reported concept, and indicates acceptance for filing, pleading cycle, or public comment schedule.
monitoring_signals: FCC ECFS searches for SpaceX filings mentioning data centers/orbital compute
FCC International Bureau public notices and satellite application lists
Industry analyst notes on SpaceX non-Starlink satellite proposals
predictions.rationale: If SpaceX is serious, a formal FCC process step (acceptance/docketing) is a likely near-term milestone; timeline depends on application completeness and FCC workload.

predictions.text: CoStar Group will announce either (a) a settlement with Third Point/Dan Loeb that includes appointing at least one new independent director, or (b) a unilateral appointment of at least one new independent director, by 2026-08-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if CoStar issues a press release, 8-K, proxy filing, or board update naming at least one newly appointed director described as independent, with announcement date on/before the deadline; may be tied explicitly to Third Point or not.
monitoring_signals: CoStar 8-K filings and board/governance webpage updates
Third Point letters/13D amendments indicating negotiations
Proxy advisor commentary (ISS/Glass Lewis) and annual meeting materials
predictions.rationale: Activist campaigns often culminate in board refreshes; however, management resistance and timing around the proxy calendar create meaningful uncertainty.

predictions.text: Kraft Heinz will publicly announce a strategic review that includes evaluating a breakup/spin or sale of a major business segment or brand portfolio representing at least $2.0 billion in annual net sales (as cited in the announcement), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Kraft Heinz press releases, investor presentation, or SEC filings explicitly state it is reviewing options including spin/breakup or sale for a segment/portfolio and provides (or clearly implies via segment reporting) annual net sales >= $2.0B for the assets under review.
monitoring_signals: KHC earnings calls language on portfolio actions and bankers retained
Rumors of divestiture processes for specific brand groups
Activist/analyst notes pushing sum-of-the-parts restructurings
predictions.rationale: Packaged-food restructuring pressure is rising; still, an explicit strategic review with size disclosure is a high bar and may be delayed by execution risk and valuation.

predictions.text: A U.S. congressional committee (House or Senate) will hold a public hearing that explicitly references allegations that WhatsApp chats “aren’t private” (or equivalent language) and discusses end-to-end encryption/privacy assurances, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if an official committee hearing notice, transcript, or video title/agenda includes WhatsApp and explicitly addresses the cited privacy allegation (or the specific investigation claim) and E2EE/privacy assurances.
monitoring_signals: House Energy & Commerce / Judiciary and Senate Judiciary / Commerce hearing calendars
Witness lists including Meta, Signal, Apple, Google, or DOJ/FBI
New letters from members of Congress requesting WhatsApp disclosures
predictions.rationale: Congress often uses high-profile privacy allegations to anchor hearings, but calendar competition and classified sensitivities reduce likelihood within 5 months.

predictions.text: Bitcoin (BTC-USD) will have at least one daily close below $70,000 on a major reference price index (e.g., Coin Metrics or Coinbase spot close) by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if BTC-USD posts at least one daily close < 70,000 (UTC-based day) on Coin Metrics reference rate, or if unavailable, Coinbase BTC-USD daily close < 70,000 (documented).
monitoring_signals: Crypto volatility (DVOL/BVOL) and perp funding rates
ETF flow data and stablecoin issuance/redemptions
Macro risk-off moves linked to Fed policy and yields
predictions.rationale: Given recent cross-asset volatility and crypto’s drawdown behavior, a ~10% additional drop from recent levels is plausible within a 3-month window.

predictions.text: The U.S. Senate Banking Committee will hold a public hearing for the President’s nominee to be the next Federal Reserve Chair (Powell’s successor), by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the Senate Banking Committee publishes an official hearing notice and/or webcast page for the Fed Chair nominee confirmation hearing on or before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: White House nomination announcement and transmitted paperwork to Senate
Senate Banking Committee calendar updates
Press reports on vetting completion and hearing scheduling
predictions.rationale: Once a nominee is named, committees typically schedule hearings quickly; delays are possible if paperwork/vetting issues arise or if Senate time is constrained.

predictions.text: NHTSA (or USDOT) will publish a public research note, safety advisory, or formal guidance explicitly addressing adversarial/prompt-injection-style attacks on road signs or visual cues that could mislead ADAS/autonomous driving perception systems, by 2026-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NHTSA or USDOT posts an official document (PDF/webpage) explicitly describing adversarial manipulation of road signs/visual prompts to mislead vehicle AI/perception, and frames it as a safety/security risk with recommendations or research findings.
monitoring_signals: NHTSA ODI publications and USDOT ITS/JPO releases
AV safety framework updates and workshop agendas
Academic/industry disclosures that spur regulator response
predictions.rationale: The vulnerability is salient and regulator-relevant, but NHTSA may treat it as research rather than issuing explicit guidance, making publication within the year uncertain.

predictions.text: The UK Prime Minister will make an official visit to China and meet with Xi Jinping in Beijing (or at another official venue in China), by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the UK government, China’s MFA/Xinhua, or reputable major media report an official UK PM visit to China with a bilateral meeting with Xi Jinping occurring on/before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Downing Street travel schedules and readouts
Chinese MFA announcements of high-level UK delegation visits
Trade/investment dialogues restarted or upgraded
predictions.rationale: Allies exploring hedges raises odds of a high-level reset, but domestic politics and security frictions can easily postpone a PM-Xi meeting beyond 2026.
